intro: Boston Terriers are friendly, compact companions with distinctive tuxedo markings. Their flat faces and prominent eyes bring health challenges including eye injuries, breathing difficulties, and spinal issues. Insurance helps manage these brachycephalic breed conditions.
whyInsurance: Bostons face eye injuries (cherry eye, ulcers), BOAS (breathing problems), and spinal issues. Their eye prominence makes injuries common. Insurance covers both emergencies and chronic conditions.

faqs.question: Is pet insurance worth it for a Boston Terrier?
faqs.answer: Yes. Bostons commonly face eye injuries, breathing issues, and spinal problems. Their prominent eyes are especially vulnerable. Insurance helps manage frequent eye-related costs.

faqs.question: Why do Boston Terriers have eye problems?
faqs.answer: Their large, prominent eyes are easily injured and prone to dryness, ulcers, and cherry eye. Many Bostons need eye treatment at some point in their lives.

faqs.question: Do Boston Terriers have breathing problems?
faqs.answer: Many do. Their flat faces can cause breathing difficulties, especially in heat or during exercise. Some need surgery to improve airflow.

faqs.question: What are hemivertebrae?
faqs.answer: Malformed spinal bones that can cause pain or paralysis. Common in screw-tailed breeds. Severe cases may need surgery.

faqs.question: How long do Boston Terriers live?
faqs.answer: 11-13 years typically. Avoiding overheating and managing eye health helps maximize lifespan.
